Posts.Content: rhodagrl wrote: Hi, this is my first post. I am having a wire guided excisional biopsy tomorrow. Yes, I am nervous, but mostly about getting the wire put in. This started nearly a year ago when  I discovered a lump last December. I had a mammogram in Feb. followed by an U/S the same day.The lump doesn't show up on the mamm, my breasts are too dense. The radiologist said everything was fine, just normal hormonal changes, though I didn't know what he meant as I had a hyst. at 24.  I went for a 6 month follow-up mamm and U/S in early Sept. The radiologist again said everything was fine. Then he calls me at home about a 10 days later (on a Sunday) to tell me that they think I need a biopsy. I go in for a core needle bio. Not too bad at all. Though she only took one sample. Results next day are stromal fibrosis. B9. I ask for a copy of the reports.  I look up all the words and decide I need a second opinion. I go to a breast center in a large city with a good rep. The doctor is a oncologist/surgeon. She said I was right to come in. The mass hasn't gotten larger 1.6cm), but it has changed shape. It has angular margins and is hypoechoic w/internal echoes. She said it needed to come out which is what we are doing tomorrow. Can someone tell me about the wire thing? I will be under for the excis. but not the wire insert and it is making me a little freaky now. I try not to think about and just get informed so I will know what they are talking about, but I need some help. Forgive the misspellings. These words are still new to me. Thanks for your help. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy rhodagrl JayeGA

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 11:24AM rhodagrl wrote: Thanks for all your info. Had everything done Tuesday. The wire locater did hurt a bit when the Dr. had to move the wire around to get it the right position, but alls well that ends well. I found out yesterday that it was benign. Am very happy about that. I did ask for a copy of the report so I could read all the info myself. Thanks for the well wishes too. Rhodagrl
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy rhodagrl JayeGA
